metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22827 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
storeAtts in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integeroverflow.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
libexpat1 - 2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4
No subscription required

firefox - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-geckodriver - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 98.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: expat package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.5-3ubuntu0.4').
xmlrpc-c: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
